intro: Tragia bicornis, commonly known as the two-horned tragia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive two-horned calyx that persists on the fruit. Its small, yellow flowers are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Tragia bicornis is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
